name: Nuits Saint-Pierre

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really appreciated the airport pick-up and return transfer. We stayed for two nights and had a wonderful experience. The B&B decor is modern and very pleasant with a small sofa at the foot of the bed. The bathroom featured a large shower. WiFi service allowed us to stay in touch with home. We enjoyed the breakfasts, which had quite a variety of continental items but also eggs cooked to order. The nearby cathedral bells start marking the hour at 7 am, but we enjoyed this.
reviews.title: A very comfortable bed and breakfast

reviews.text: Located in the center of town. Very attractive rooms and fabulous hospitality. Owner could not have been any more helpful and friendly. Patricia also has a great sandwich shop/bakery next door. Could place an order for what you wanted for breakfast.
reviews.title: wonderful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A little taste of France smack in the middle of the Gulf of St. Lawrence and Atlantic Ocean. From the moment we arrived the staff/owner is a real treat. She met us at the airport and gave us some tips on what to do on her little island. We checked into a nicely appointed room with a private bath. The breakfast included in the room rate was delicious and plentiful. You couldn't ask for a better location, walking distance to everything. The local information they provide at the B&B gives you all the scoop on the things to do on the 3 islands you can visit during your stay. I also recommend a visit to the Tea Room - the deserts and the cheese plates are yummy!!
reviews.title: Wonderful B&B

reviews.text: I took my 88 year old Mother to St. Pierre and stayed here for three days. Everything was wonderful!
reviews.title: Europe without the travel........

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Patricia, the owner/operator, is kind, patient, generous, friendly, suggestive, and beautiful inside & out. Her accommodations and coffee shop are the finest on the Island.
reviews.title: Most French thing about the island

description: Nuits Saint-Pierre is a sumptuous Boutique Hotel housed in a fully restored heritage building. A haven of exquisite elegance, Nuits Saint-Pierre has all the modern luxuries and conveniences. Everything is designed for your ease and comfort. It’s the perfect place for a holiday, a business trip or a romantic getaway.Located right downtown you will only be a minute away from the ferry terminal and a few steps from the restaurants and the shopping area.
